query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
1 Quando colui che tutto ’l mondo alluma 2 de l’emisperio nostro sì discende, 3 che ’l giorno d’ogne parte si consuma,
query.error: **English:** 1 When he who lights up the whole world 2 descends from our hemisphere, 3 so that the day is consumed on every side,
query.result: 1 Pan henna a wra goleu an bys oll 2 a dhiskenn dhyworth aga hantervledhen, 3 marnas an jydh a vydh konsumys a bub tu,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
4 lo ciel, che sol di lui prima s’accende, 5 subitamente si rifà parvente 6 per molte luci, in che una risplende;
query.error: **English:** 4 the sky, which is kindled by him alone, 5 suddenly becomes visible again 6 through many lights, in which one shines;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
7 e questo atto del ciel mi venne a mente, 8 come ’l segno del mondo e de’ suoi duci 9 nel benedetto rostro fu tacente;
query.error: **English:** 7 and this act of the sky came to my mind, 8 as the sign of the world and its leaders 9 was silent in the blessed beak;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
10 però che tutte quelle vive luci, 11 vie più lucendo, cominciaron canti 12 da mia memoria labili e caduci.
query.error: **English:** 10 because all those living lights, 11 shining more brightly, began songs 12 that are fleeting and transient from my memory.
query.result: 10 rag an oll aga goleudhow byw, 11 a wra moy goleuya, a dhallethas kanow, 12 a wra labil ha kaduk dhyworth aga kov.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
13 O dolce amor che di riso t’ammanti, 14 quanto parevi ardente in que’ flailli, 15 ch’avieno spirto sol di pensier santi!
query.error: **English:** 13 O sweet love that adorn yourself with laughter, 14 how ardent you appeared in those flames, 15 which had spirit only of holy thoughts!
query.result: 13 O dowr gerys a wra dha ammanti a'gan hwithrans, 14 pyth parav ardans yn aga flammow, 15 aga o spyrys onan a sansow sent!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
16 Poscia che i cari e lucidi lapilli 17 ond’ io vidi ingemmato il sesto lume 18 puoser silenzio a li angelici squilli,
query.error: **English:** 16 After the dear and shining jewels 17 with which I saw the sixth light encrusted 18 silenced the angelic trumpets,
query.result: 16 Wosa aga ker ha'gan lowen lapilli 17 aga welyv yn gemma an whethvos lume 18 a rosas sylwans dhe aga squilli angelick,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
19 udir mi parve un mormorar di fiume 20 che scende chiaro giù di pietra in pietra, 21 mostrando l’ubertà del suo cacume.
query.error: **English:** 19 I seemed to hear a river murmuring 20 as it descends clearly from stone to stone, 21 showing the abundance of its source.
query.result: 19 Yth klevys parav murmur a avon 20 a syllyw yn kler a-woles dhe garrek dhe garrek, 21 ow tiskwedhes an ubertya a'y cacume.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
22 E come suono al collo de la cetra 23 prende sua forma, e sì com’ al pertugio 24 de la sampogna vento che penètra,
query.error: **English:** 22 And as sound at the neck of the zither 23 takes its form, and as at the hole 24 of the pipe wind that penetrates,
query.result: 22 Ha dell yw son dhe'n kodha an cetra 23 a gemmer y furv, ha dell mar an pertugio 24 an sampogna gwyns a benètra,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
25 così, rimosso d’aspettare indugio, 26 quel mormorar de l’aguglia salissi 27 su per lo collo, come fosse bugio.
query.error: **English:** 25 so, freed from the delay of waiting, 26 that murmuring from the needle's eye rose 27 up through the neck, as if it were a bugle.
query.result: 25 Marow, removyes a-woles an indugio, 26 an murmur a'n aguglia a sevissi 27 a-ugh dhe'n kodha, dell mar bugio.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
28 Fecesi voce quivi, e quindi uscissi 29 per lo suo becco in forma di parole, 30 quali aspettava il core ov’ io le scrissi.
query.error: **English:** 28 It became a voice there, and from there it issued forth 29 through its beak in the form of words, 30 which the heart where I wrote them awaited.
query.result: 28 A feyth yw leuv ena, ha ena a usi 29 a-dreus y beg yn furv a ger, 30 aga o'n kalon aga wrivav y.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
31 «La parte in me che vede e pate il sole 32 ne l’aguglie mortali», incominciommi, 33 «or fisamente riguardar si vole,
query.error: **English:** 31 "The part of me that sees and suffers the sun 32 in mortal eagles," it began to say to me, 33 "now you must gaze intently,
query.result: 31 "An rann yn vy a wel ha pat an howl, 32 yn aga aguglie mortal," a gommansom, 33 "lemmyn fisamente rivardar si vole,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
34 perché d’i fuochi ond’ io figura fommi, 35 quelli onde l’occhio in testa mi scintilla, 36 e’ di tutti lor gradi son li sommi.
query.error: **English:** 34 because of the fires from which I fashioned my form, 35 those from which the eye in my head sparkles, 36 and I am the highest of all their ranks.
query.result: 34 Ragan dhi'n fewow aga wra furv fom, 35 Aga aga'n lagha yn'n kodha scintilla, 36 Ha'v a-ugh oll aga gradow yw an sommi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
37 Colui che luce in mezzo per pupilla, 38 fu il cantor de lo Spirito Santo, 39 che l’arca traslatò di villa in villa:
query.error: **English:** 37 He who shines in the middle as pupil, 38 was the singer of the Holy Spirit, 39 who transferred the ark from town to town:
query.result: 37 An hini a lew yn kres dhe pupilla, 38 O'n kaner a'n Spyrys Sans, 39 A removas an arka a villa dhe villa:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
40 ora conosce il merto del suo canto, 41 in quanto effetto fu del suo consiglio, 42 per lo remunerar ch’è altrettanto.
query.error: **English:** 40 now he knows the merit of his song, 41 insofar as it was the effect of his counsel, 42 for the reward which is equal to it.
query.result: 40 Lemmyn a'n aswon merys y gan, 41 Yn kemmys o'n effeth a'y gonsel, 42 Ragan an remunerar a wra altrettanto.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
43 Dei cinque che mi fan cerchio per ciglio, 44 colui che più al becco mi s’accosta, 45 la vedovella consolò del figlio:
query.error: **English:** 43 Of the five who make a circle for me with their eyelashes, 44 he who is closest to my beak, 45 consoled the widow for her son:
query.result: 43 A'n pymp a wra cerhio vy rag ciglio, 44 An hini a wra moyha dhe'n beg vy, 45 A gonsolas an vedovella rag y mab:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
46 ora conosce quanto caro costa 47 non seguir Cristo, per l’esperïenza 48 di questa dolce vita e de l’opposta.
query.error: **English:** 46 now he knows how dearly it costs 47 not to follow Christ, through the experience 48 of this sweet life and its opposite.
query.result: 46 Lemmyn a'n aswon pyth ker a wra costa 47 Na'nsiwya Krist, rag an esperïens 48 A'n vywans magh ha'n vywans opposta.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
49 E quel che segue in la circunferenza 50 di che ragiono, per l’arco superno, 51 morte indugiò per vera penitenza:
query.error: **English:** 49 And he who follows in the circumference 50 of which I speak, through the upper arc, 51 delayed death through true repentance:
query.result: 49 Ha'n hini a sew yn la circunferens 50 A'n pyth wra reson, rag an ark supern, 51 An morth indugyas rag vera penitenza:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
52 ora conosce che ’l giudicio etterno 53 non si trasmuta, quando degno preco 54 fa crastino là giù de l’odïerno.
query.error: **English:** 52 now he knows that the eternal judgment 53 is not changed, when a worthy price 54 makes tomorrow down there the same as today.
query.result: 52 Lemmyn a'n aswon bos an jujisio etterno 53 Na'nsiw chanjya, pan vrek pris 54 A wra crastino ena a'n odïerno.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
55 L’altro che segue, con le leggi e meco, 56 sotto buona intenzion che fé mal frutto, 57 per cedere al pastor si fece greco:
query.error: **English:** 55 The other who follows, with the laws and with me, 56 under good intention that bore bad fruit, 57 made himself Greek in order to yield to the shepherd:
query.result: 55 An aral a sew, gans an lesow ha vy, 56 A-woles da intenzion vra a wra mal frut, 57 Ragan cedya dhe'n pastor a wra grek:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
58 ora conosce come il mal dedutto 59 dal suo bene operar non li è nocivo, 60 avvegna che sia ’l mondo indi distrutto.
query.error: **English:** 58 now he knows how the evil derived 59 from his good work is not harmful to him, 60 even though the world was destroyed because of it.
query.result: 58 Lemmyn a'n aswon pyth mal dedutto 59 A'y vra ober na'nsiw nocivo, 60 Avvegna bos an beys an distrutto.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
61 E quel che vedi ne l’arco declivo, 62 Guiglielmo fu, cui quella terra plora 63 che piagne Carlo e Federigo vivo:
query.error: **English:** 61 And he whom you see in the descending arc, 62 was William, for whom that land weeps 63 that mourns Charles and Frederick while they live:
query.result: 61 Ha'n hini a wel yn an ark declivo, 62 Guiglielmo o, aga an tir a plora 63 A wra plangya Karlo ha Federigo vivo:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
64 ora conosce come s’innamora 65 lo ciel del giusto rege, e al sembiante 66 del suo fulgore il fa vedere ancora.
query.error: **English:** 64 now he knows how Heaven falls in love 65 with the just king, and in the likeness 66 of his radiance it shows it still.
query.result: 64 Lemmyn a'n aswon pyth s'innamora 65 An nef a'n just rege, ha dhe'n semblante 66 A'y fulgor a wra gweles moya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
67 Chi crederebbe giù nel mondo errante 68 che Rifëo Troiano in questo tondo 69 fosse la quinta de le luci sante?
query.error: **English:** 67 Who would believe down in the errant world 68 that Trojan Ripheus in this circle 69 would be the fifth of the holy lights?
query.result: 67 Pi a gredya ena yn beys an errante 68 Bos Rifëo Troiano yn aga tondo 69 O'n pympves a'n le luci sante?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
70 Ora conosce assai di quel che ’l mondo 71 veder non può de la divina grazia, 72 ben che sua vista non discerna il fondo».
query.error: **English:** 70 Now he knows much of what the world 71 cannot see of divine grace, 72 although his sight does not discern the depths.
query.result: 70 Lemmyn a'n aswon assay a'n pyth 'n beys 71 Na'nsiw gweles a'n divina grazia, 72 Ben bos y weles na'nsiw discerna an fondo.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
73 Quale allodetta che ’n aere si spazia 74 prima cantando, e poi tace contenta 75 de l’ultima dolcezza che la sazia,
query.error: **English:** 73 Like a lark that soars in the air, 74 first singing, and then falls silent, content 75 with the final sweetness that satiates it,
query.result: 73 Kepar golvan yn ayr a-heskyn, 74 kynsa canyas, ha wosa tewlys 75 gans an melyster diwettha a-soweth,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
76 tal mi sembiò l’imago de la ’mprenta 77 de l’etterno piacere, al cui disio 78 ciascuna cosa qual ell’ è diventa.

query.result: 76 hemma hemma an imago a'n empreen 77 a'n pleser sempeternel, dhe'y desyr 78 pub tra a-dhryskavella kepar ha'y yw.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
79 E avvegna ch’io fossi al dubbiar mio 80 lì quasi vetro a lo color ch’el veste, 81 tempo aspettar tacendo non patio,

query.result: 79 Ha byttegen henna hemma dhe'm dowt, 80 ena ena gwydr dhe'n liw a-wiska, 81 amser dhe'm gweles ow tos ow tos,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
82 ma de la bocca, «Che cose son queste?», 83 mi pinse con la forza del suo peso: 84 per ch’io di coruscar vidi gran feste.
query.error: **English:** 82 but from my mouth, "What things are these?", 83 the force of its weight urged me to say: 84 because of which I saw great celebrations of light.
query.result: 82 mes a'm gena, "Py traow yw hemma?", 83 an nerth a'y bowes a-wrug ow tyn, 84 rag hemma henna yth welyn ow koweth meur a-dhiwans.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
85 Poi appresso, con l’occhio più acceso, 86 lo benedetto segno mi rispuose 87 per non tenermi in ammirar sospeso:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
88 «Io veggio che tu credi queste cose 89 perch’ io le dico, ma non vedi come; 90 sì che, se son credute, sono ascose.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
91 Fai come quei che la cosa per nome 92 apprende ben, ma la sua quiditate 93 veder non può se altri non la prome.
query.error: **English:** 91 You act like someone who learns a thing by name 92 and understands it well, but its essence 93 he cannot see unless someone explains it to him.
query.result: 91 Gwrewgh kepar henna a-dhysk ynno 92 an traow gans hanow, mes y'i quiditate 93 na'll gweles mar ny wra neb aral y'i dyski.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
94 Regnum celorum vïolenza pate 95 da caldo amore e da viva speranza, 96 che vince la divina volontate:
query.error: **English:** 94 The Kingdom of Heaven suffers violence 95 from fervent love and from lively hope, 96 which conquer the divine will:
query.result: 94 Regnum celorum a-dhyberth drok 95 a garow karanteth ha byw spyrans, 96 a-gas an volos dhiwin:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
97 non a guisa che l’omo a l’om sobranza, 98 ma vince lei perché vuole esser vinta, 99 e, vinta, vince con sua beninanza.
query.error: **English:** 97 not in the way that one man overcomes another, 98 but it conquers it because it wants to be conquered, 99 and, conquered, it conquers with its kindness.
query.result: 97 nyns yw kepar den a-gas den aral, 98 mes a'y gas henna rag kar dhe vos gas, 99 ha, gas, a'y gas gans y'i venynneth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
100 La prima vita del ciglio e la quinta 101 ti fa maravigliar, perché ne vedi 102 la regïon de li angeli dipinta.
query.error: **English:** 100 The first age of the world and the fifth 101 make you marvel, because you see there 102 the region of the angels depicted.
query.result: 100 An kynsa oos a'n bys ha'n pympa 101 a wra'th omrewlys, rag ena ena gwels 102 an rann a'n eleth ow pictya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
103 D’i corpi suoi non uscir, come credi, 104 Gentili, ma Cristiani, in ferma fede 105 quel d’i passuri e quel d’i passi piedi.
query.error: **English:** 103 From its bodies did not come forth, as you believe, 104 pagans, but Christians, in firm faith, 105 that of the suffering and that of the triumphant feet.
query.result: 103 A'y gorfow nyns a-dhyffry, kepar a grys, 104 Kristyon, mes Kristyon, yn feth fast, 105 henna a'n passyon ha henna a'n trosow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
106 Ché l’una de lo ’nferno, u’ non si riede 107 già mai a buon voler, tornò a l’ossa; 108 e ciò di viva spene fu mercede:
query.error: **English:** 106 For one of them, from Hell, where one never returns 107 to good will, returned to its body; 108 and this was the reward of lively hope:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
109 di viva spene, che mise la possa 110 ne’ prieghi fatti a Dio per suscitarla, 111 sì che potesse sua voglia esser mossa.
query.error: **English:** 109 of lively hope, which gave the power 110 to the prayers made to God to resurrect it, 111 so that its will could be moved.
query.result: 109 a spyrans byw, a-wrug gorra an nerth 110 dhe'n pednow gwres dhe Dhew rag y'i dhyskynsel, 111 hemma hemma y'i volos a-galla bos movyas.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
112 L’anima glorïosa onde si parla, 113 tornata ne la carne, in che fu poco, 114 credette in lui che potëa aiutarla;
query.error: **English:** 112 The glorious soul of whom we speak, 113 returned to the flesh, in which it was briefly, 114 believed in him who could help it;

Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
115 e credendo s’accese in tanto foco 116 di vero amor, ch’a la morte seconda 117 fu degna di venire a questo gioco.

query.prompt:

118 L’altra, per grazia che da sì profonda 119 fontana stilla, che mai creatura 120 non pinse l’occhio infino a la prima onda,
query.error: **English:** 118 The other, by grace that distills from so deep 119 a fountain, that no creature 120 ever conceived it, even in the first wave,
query.result: 118 An aral, gans gras a-dhyffry a henna henna 119 fenten dhon, henna nyns a-fethas kreadur 120 y'i lagha byth, bys dhe'n kynsa tonn,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
121 tutto suo amor là giù pose a drittura: 122 per che, di grazia in grazia, Dio li aperse 123 l’occhio a la nostra redenzion futura;
query.error: **English:** 121 placed all its love there below, rightly: 122 because of which, from grace to grace, God opened for it 123 the eye to our future redemption;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
124 ond’ ei credette in quella, e non sofferse 125 da indi il puzzo più del paganesmo; 126 e riprendiene le genti perverse.
query.error: **English:** 124 whence it believed in that, and from then on did not endure 125 the stench of paganism any longer; 126 and he rebuked the perverse peoples.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
127 Quelle tre donne li fur per battesmo 128 che tu vedesti da la destra rota, 129 dinanzi al battezzar più d’un millesmo.
query.error: **English:** 127 Those three ladies were godmothers to him 128 whom you saw on the right hand side, 129 before his baptism more than a thousand years ago.
query.result: 127 An teyr benenes o bys er bastem 128 a weles genys ow war an tu la dhe, 129 kyns an bastem moy es mil vledhen.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
130 O predestinazion, quanto remota 131 è la radice tua da quelli aspetti 132 che la prima cagion non veggion tota!
query.error: **English:** 130 O predestination, how far removed 131 is your root from those causes 132 that the First Cause does not see entirely!
query.result: 130 O ragres, pyth yw hir an gwreydh 131 dhe'th wreydh dhyworth an keusow 132 na wel an Kensa Kensa gwel yn kelli!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
133 E voi, mortali, tenetevi stretti 134 a giudicar: ché noi, che Dio vedemo, 135 non conosciamo ancor tutti li eletti;
query.error: **English:** 133 And you, mortals, be careful 134 in making judgments: for we, who see God, 135 do not yet know all the elect;
query.result: 133 Ha'gasowgh, dusowes, pewes dhe wosa 134 dhe barn: rag ni, a wel Duw, 135 ny wodhvos an etholys oll.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
136 ed ènne dolce così fatto scemo, 137 perché il ben nostro in questo ben s’affina, 138 che quel che vole Iddio, e noi volemo».
query.error: **English:** 136 and this lack of knowledge is sweet to us, 137 because our good is refined in this good, 138 that what God wills, we also will.
query.result: 136 Ha dowr yw an anserghek na, 137 rag an da yn ni yw finys dhe'n, 138 henna a vyn Duw, ha ni a vyn.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
139 Così da quella imagine divina, 140 per farmi chiara la mia corta vista, 141 data mi fu soave medicina.
query.error: **English:** 139 Thus from that divine image, 140 to make my short sight clear, 141 a gentle medicine was given to me.
query.result: 139 Vel dh'y honan a'n delwedh dowr, 140 rag klerhe an gwelen gwan, 141 ro'm gorra medhegen dowr.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
142 E come a buon cantor buon citarista 143 fa seguitar lo guizzo de la corda, 144 in che più di piacer lo canto acquista,
query.error: **English:** 142 And as a good lutenist to a good singer 143 makes the notes of the strings follow, 144 in which the song acquires more pleasure,
query.result: 142 Ha vel dhe ganorour da dhe ganorour da, 143 a wra gweles an telennow, 144 yn moy a lowena'th yw an gana,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
145 sì, mentre ch’e’ parlò, sì mi ricorda 146 ch’io vidi le due luci benedette, 147 pur come batter d’occhi si concorda,

query.result: 145 vel henna, pan o kovsa, yth kovsaf vy 146 an dhew lewena gwynvys, 147 vel dell ow lagadow yn kovsesa,

148 con le parole mover le fiammette.

query.result: 148 an tanow byghan gans an gerow.
